article.title: A New Class of de Sitter Vacua in Type IIB Large Volume Compactifications

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the Hessian matrix (H) represent in the context of moduli stabilization?
choices: The mass matrix of the moduli fields.
The potential energy of the moduli fields.
The kinetic energy of the moduli fields.
The interaction strength between the moduli fields.

multiple_choice_question.text: This formula describes the compactification volume (V) in what specific scenario?
choices: KKLT Scenario
Large Volume Scenario (LVS)
Randall-Sundrum Scenario
STU-model

multiple_choice_question.text: What physical quantity does the flux-induced superpotential (W0) determine in the four-dimensional effective theory?
choices: The kinetic energy of the moduli fields.
The gauge couplings of the visible sector.
The cosmological constant.
The mass of the gravitino.

multiple_choice_question.text: What symmetry does this equation represent?
choices: Supersymmetry
No-scale symmetry
Conformal symmetry
S-duality

multiple_choice_question.text: This critical point equation for the complex structure and axio-dilaton sector arises due to what condition in the context of de Sitter vacua at large volume?
choices: The requirement of minimizing the LVS scalar potential.
The inclusion of non-vanishing F-terms for these fields.
The dominant contribution of the second term in the potential.
The stabilization of the \'small\' KÂ¨ahler moduli by non-perturbative effects.
